Sequence Information.Peptide Name: BacZY05 (natural AMPs, bacteriocins; Gram-positive bacteria, prokaryotes)

Literature.Author: Chandrika K, Sachan A. 2024
Literature.Reference: World J Microbiol Biotechnol. 2024 Aug 2;40(9):287. doi: 10.1007/s11274-024-04093-w.PubMed
Literature.Title: Biosynthesis of bacteriocin BacZY05-silver nanoconjugates and evaluation of their antibacterial properties

Sequence Information.Comments: Discovery: isolation, purification and de novo sequencing (partial) and genome mapping.Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is unique and shows only very low similarity (30.65%) toBM173S: 15%; L: 12%. GRAVY: -0.627; mol Wt: 6557.327; mol formula: C276H451N85O93S3; mol ex coeff: 3042.5.Activity: active against S. aureus MTCC3103 (MIC 10.93 ug/ml), K. pneumoniae MTCC109 (MIC 10.93 ug/ml), S. typhi NCIM2501 (MIC 28.75 ug/ml), V. cholerae MTCC3909 (MIC 57.5 ug/ml), and E. coli DH5alpha (MIC 57.5 ug/ml). MBC are doubled. Activity also observed by diffusion assays (zone of inhibition). Est. 8/2024
